lines.text: Do you know how the police refer to victims of crime?
Customers?
Yes!
What does that make criminals - clients?
Never a frown with Gordon Brown.
Only 2% of people go to church in this country
And they're priests!
[Osama bin Laden's brother has released a perfume, described as 'inner peace in a bottle']
Sod the perfume, if you want inner peace, shoot your brother!
[on a question about Pokémon]

This is the probably worst and worst-drawn film and craze in history, of badly-conceived little monsters that fight each other, and children trade cards and have a fantastic knowledge of a hundred and fifty monsters. They can't remember five countries and their capital cities, but just about every child in the country can tell you that Charmeleon evolves into Charmander and then turns into Machop and then kills someone or other, it's absolute garbage.
[flippantly]
I've got an idea for these medieval history cards that I think are going to be a big hit in the playground.
You're pretty angry about this, aren't you?
I'm very, very bored. I've seen the Pokémon movie, which is probably the worst movie ever made on any subject ever.
You haven't seen "Kevin & Perry Go Large", then?
And did you chat with the Queen Mother?
We talked about you.
No, you didn't.
Yes, we did.
What did she say about me?
I've never heard such language in all my life.

[reading out headline during missing words round]
I made Thatcher 'what' boasts Nigel.
Swallow?
[after learning that a series has been tied at an equal number of games for each team]
Well, why didn't you have an odd number of programmes, you idiot?
Archer has issued a strenuious denial - as good as a signed confession, really!
I should go on Mastermind, answering questions on the life and times of Jeffery Archer. I'd get more questions right than he would!

[During a discussion on short-sighted dogs receiving spectacles, or doggles]
Getting their vision back could be a bit of a shock - "oh, so *that's* what I've been sniffing all this time!"

[on Mark Thatcher being implicated in a coup]
After Archer was implicated, we thought it couldn't happen to a nicer person. How wrong we were!
[the teams watch a clip of John Kerry attending a church service during the election]
Reading the Bible, checking to find something he's missed.
Yes, Queen Elizabeth I was bald and had wooden teeth and yet somehow managed to remain a virgin.
[while Anne Robinson is guest-hosting]
[yells out at random points]
Bank!

Revisionist historians now claim that far from being mad, Joan of Arc may have been a victim of food poisoning. Makes sense, I can't tell you the number of times I've eaten a few dodgy prawns and ended up commanding the French army.
[at the end of the quiz]
So Ian wins based on questions about his magazine and people he's met on the train!

Yes, this is the Pokémon phenomenon that has swept the UK. One school in Berkshire has banned Pokémon after instances of bullying to obtain the rarer cards. The bullying has finally stopped however, now that Mr. Hunt the geography teacher has the complete set.
[discussing Christine Hamilton's chat show]
It's actually Christine who sings the theme tune herself.
Oh, my God, she doesn't, does she? The poor deluded cow.
What was right up Napoleon's street?
Napoleon's house!

[asked to sum up the Million Man March]
Louis Farrakhan says America is racist and he blames the Jews.

[missing headline round]
What turns blue in fridge?
Queen Mother!
It is getting rather sad when I can't win against Paul when he's accompanied by a tub of lard and the questions are in a foreign language.
I used to go out with a girl who smelled like a bonfire.
She was a witch, was she?
She may have been a witch, but oh, she was a goer!
[caption competition - a group of North Korean military officers, chests covered in medals, singing with gusto, their mouths making perfect 'O' shapes]
That bloke on the top right is saying "For God's sake somebody go 'klahoma!"
Do you still live in Islington as well, Boris?
Partly, yes.
I don't think you live on the planet Earth, never mind Islington!
I think we should get off my, um, my property.
I can see you as Zorro!
Zorro, the gay blade!
I've never been accused of that - yet!

[on Bush and Rumsfeld]
They're like an old couple with some holiday brochures. "Where shall we invade next? Cuba looks nice."

Good evening and welcome to the last programme of the millennium, although as there's a compilation show next week, it's not strictly speaking the last one, but then again strictly speaking it's not the end of the millennium either. Still, who's counting, or indeed watching by now.

This is, somebody was planning to make - and have, I think, made - a jacket, a hundred hamsters have gone into this jacket, and animal rights protesters have said this is terrible, and Gieves & Hawkes
[pronounced "Geeves"]
I believe are the names of the tailors, Savile Row tailors.
"Gieves"
[pron. "Jeeves"]
, I think you'll find.
"Gieves"? Is it Gieves?
Could be. Sounds more likely, doesn't it?
Does it? How's it spelled?
G-E-I.
[sic]
Ah, that's the thing that threw me you see, I was following the letters.
So Gieves & Hawkes, yes, that's right. And what have they been...
So "Gieves", how do you spell "Gieves"? G-I-E-V-E-S?
Yeah.
Was there a special day at school where they wrote all these names on a blackboard, because I must have been off sick. So the tailors, they've made a "gacket"...
I think the quiz element of this show is overrated.
[answering a question about dogs]
There was something the other day about a dog, I mean I think Paul's probably right...
Well, we can't compete with this level of research!

Good evening and welcome to the programme attacked this week by one viewer who wrote to complain about random way the points are allocated, on the grounds that "the level of money wagered on the outcome of this show increases week on week". So our apologies to Mr. Joseph Wall of Newark, and one point to Ian.
Do I sense that this is another week you haven't been reading the papers?
Absolutely. It's a great burden off my shoulders.
Evidently. And onto ours, by the sounds of it.
What does that mean?
It means the burden passes from yours to his because he has to fill you in on the story, it's not too difficult.
Michael Winner also admitted, "I actually find it slightly funny when a celebrity dies - which I shouldn't". Don't worry, Michael, we'll all piss ourselves when you die.

[mishears something Paul says]
Half an hour on a giraffe?
No, not right now I've got to do this.
[pause]
I wouldn't mind half an hour on a giraffe though. Very sexy animals, giraffes
You don't need to tell me.

Yeah, they can see when the police are coming so when they get there you can say, "No, it's nothing." I used to go out with a giraffe. Used to take it to the pictures and that. You'd always get some bloke complaining that he couldn't see the screen. "It's a giraffe, mate. What d'you expect?". "Well he can take his hat off for a start!"
I may be out of touch, but I've eaten a Golden Graham!
I couldn't disagree with you less.
[caption competition - a photo of a solemn-looking Angus wearing a motorbike helmet with a skull and crossbones on it, but also wearing a shirt and tie as per usual. A biker is in the background]
General Pinochet's right hand man arrested at last.
New chapter opens of Hells Chartered Accountants.
How do you like your blue-eyed boy, Mr Death?
[this draws the biggest laugh from the audience]
Angus takes his stabilisers off.
Your toupee'll be ready in a moment, Mr Deayton.
Apparently the Queen also refers to John Prescott as "Two Jags".
That's rich coming from Elizabeth "Six castles" Windsor!

[to Michael Crick]
Archer's obviously very aware of your interest in him. We've got a clip of him here complaining about the way that the BBC make programs about him.
[clip of a visibly annoyed Jeffrey Archer talking to a camera crew in a park plays]
Oh, hello, Mr Crick - what do you think of think Jeffrey Archer - clip-clip-clip! Oh, come on! Who are you kidding? You wait til I'm mayor, you'll find out how tough I am! Christ almighty!
[audience laughs]
Can I put in a special request in to see that all again?
Yeah, I don't see why not, let's have it again.
[the clip plays again, everyone laughs again]
Brilliant. You'd have to have a heart of stone not to laugh out loud, wouldn't you?
It is funny how whenever the Tories look as though they might be just coming off the level of utterly hopeless, Archer pops up!
Is the answer jam?
[silence]
Not in so many words, no.
I only said that because last week Eddie Izzard said that and you roared with laughter, as if it was hilarious. Just thought I'd say it.
People like him.
The answer is tennis ball. The tragic tale of a two ton hippo who swallowed a tennis ball in Germany.

[to Piers Morgan]
Surely you must have covered that in the Daily Mirror? That's exactly the sort of, page 5 story?
What do you know about newspaper editing, Clive?
About as much as you do!
I gather it took you six days to write this book. Did you get writer's block or something?
You say one more thing, he's going to hit you.
Yeah, I will and all. I'd take great pleasure thumping my fist into that great face of yours.

[narrowing her eyes at Ian]
Don't even look at me. You sperm of the devil.
[audience laughs. She tries to carry on talking but Ian is too busy sneering at the malapropism she's just made]
Sperm of the devil! Even your insults emanate from the genitals!
The word spelled wrong was 'vocabulary', in fact. And so, for an extra point, how do you spell it?
Vocabulary. V-O-C-A-B-U-L-A-R-Y.
Uh, no, I'm afraid you've fallen for the oldest schoolboy joke in the world...
I-T?
...you actually spell 'it', I-T.

[groans]
Oh, I-T... Oh, please! Oh... That is pathetic!
Sheila Hancock's a respected actress! You drag her along here and go "How do you spell 'it'?"! She's a respected actress!
You're meant to be Jeremy Paxman, not Jeremy Beadle!

I was on Desert Island Discs once, and they asked me what my luxury should be and I said "Frosties", and then Frosties sent me a year's supply. My wife said I was an idiot and should have said "A BMW".
A Desert Island with Frosties? What were you going to put on the Frosties?
Milk.
Where'd you get the milk?
A Coconut.
How'd you get in the Coconut?
With a knife I'd fashioned from my Tibia!
I hate bread. Ever since I was seven. That's not food, it's a napkin.
You know, historically it is food. All those ducks can't be wrong.
It's bad for the ducks too! It's Quack Cocaine!

[on the news story of a 15 year-old hacker who compromised TalkTalk's customer database]
These teenagers! What are their Mothers doing, banging on the wall yelling "You'd better be wanking in there and not bringing down a Large Corporation!"?
[laughter and applause]
The two activities are not mutually exclusive.

[she's misheard something he said about the parachuted beavers story]
Ah, you were on a "beaver" theme.
I thought you were saying that sex was "invading the creek", and I loved that!
Well, we could do a retake.

It'll be paid for out of efficiency cuts. Which means sacking people, usually. The idea that the NHS wasn't 7 days is a bit of a scandal, anyway. One of the reasons it's not is because GPs were given this amazing contract where they don't have to work after hours any more. And all that was outsourced to people who said they'd do it cheaper, and like most outsourcing you do it cheaper because you don't do it very well!
[applause]
I was watching Big Brother the other night...
Oh, I did a project on that, for school!
...I think I'm going to kill myself.
The President asked me what "State" Wales was in.
And you said "Terrible"?

[reporting on 2015 Election]
UKIP are in danger of becoming like an Absolutist Monarchy or a Personality C***. Sorry! Cult!

[to David Shayler, who appeared via satellite link]
The Official Secrets Act is just a piece of paper to you, isn't it?
Can I just say that I don't call Hitler "The Fuhrer"? It's just written there.
So you were Only Following Orders?
A man trying to be festive painted the phrase "Let it snow!" across the front windows of his house. Unfortunately, from the front it just says... "Tits now!"
They've moved
[the painting]
from one room in the Gallery to another. That's hardly news!

[Ian has used the word "less" improperly]
Fewer!
May I say what an honour it is to be corrected by you?

[Robert]
Maxwell was a crook and an arms dealer and he's dead so he can't sue.

[on hearing that Iain Duncan Smith has another middle name]
There's four of him?

Live Lobsters are great because you can smuggle them through Customs. I had some with me once and the guy said "You can't take those on Board, they're alive!" I asked "Could I take them on if they were dead?" and he said "Yes". So I started taking my Brooch off. "What are you doing?" he asked, and I said "I'm going to kill them." "Not in front of me, you're not" he said, so I just took them on.

[Google Books' digital errors]
What happens in Scotland, on Bums Night?
They all join anuses and sing Auld Lang Syne!
"She flung her anus around his neck..."

["Ambulance Today" Magazine in Missing Words Round]
Emergency Services Drivers humour is inappropriately dark, disturbing and graphic. That's from "Ambulance Today", which is what you optimistically shout down the phone if you want an ambulance.
The following program features mature language and adult humour, but it's mostly directed against Politicians.

[DJ fired for playing "The Sun has got his Hat on"]
The N-word apparently is acceptable if spelled colloquially with an "a" on the end instead of "er". So says a BBC WANKA!
...Allegedly!
Dogs dogged Doug's dogged dog!
Is this what it's like going to University?
Well, keep in mind I did Metalwork.

Well, there was this chap and he went on a high and thought it would be a marvellous idea to take his car apart and arrange all the parts out neatly. And of course halfway through he had a crash into depression. Which was made even worse by the fact he had no car.

[Refereeing Magazine, Missing Words round]
"At the start of your career, you should ask other referees about what, what, and what?"
Offside, onside and suicide?

I often start talking in a Southern American accent. I was talking to this lady the other night and she found out I was a comedian and said "Oh, what do you know about Tommy Cooper", and I said "He dead". She said "Sorry, I must be terribly British and correct your grammar, I think you'll find it's "He died"". I said "At first he died, but now he dead!"
How did Tony Blair slip up this week giving a speech about the NHS?
Was it the old joke about the politician who stands up and says "The NHS's safe is in my hands. No, sorry, I mean the NHS is safe in my hands!"?

[Google Books digital errors]
"He paid tribute to the dead Captain, who had been one of his Comrades in Anus."

["The Queen is dead" Tweet]
There was that rather over-excited nurse, too, wasn't there? At least she was in Hospital that time.
Yes, it's rare but not unheard of in this country that after going into Hospital you come out again.
Lee HARVEY Oswald.
That film came out in 1952!
Careful we might be being Bugsed! One off the cuff...
Well it's certainly not one off the script!
How are rabbits being used in the fight against Islamic State? MiximatISIS!

[Stephen Hawking wants to be a Bond Villain]
Stephen Hawking operates his Voice Synthesiser by moving one muscle in his face, so he's already doing better than Roger Moore...

Stephen Hawking had an upgrade on his Computerised Voice Synthesiser, so it's faster now but he lost all his old photos, and it's made him think about the dangers of Artificial Intelligence, because it predicts what he's saying, so he feels the need to warn us of the dangers of technology rising up against us. And, of course, Professor Schwartzenegger tried to warn us about this back in the Eighties in Terminator!
What Literary Award have you just won?
The Bad Sex Award!
The Bad Sex Award?
Sorry, the Bad Sex in Literature Award!
I was going to say, you took winning that quite well!
You won that first award, too, though, didn't you?

[Nigel Farage's Claridges Gaffe]
I think it's interesting that he's against breastfeeding when we have Page 3 in the Sun, which presumably he's for?
As a personal freedom issue, yes.
As opposed to breastfeeding in Hotel Lobbies?
Which is down to taste!
[laughter, applause]
Did he say that? That he was against Page 3?
We haven't asked him.
I'm not rooting for the guy. It's just he fucks up so often you don't need to be making stuff up!

["Poor people can't cook" Headline]
What did you have for breakfast?
Oh, no time for Breakfast! Coffee and Cigarettes!
And wild, wild women!
Yeah, name the bugger!
Norway says the British sense of humour is the most stupid and pointless in the World. Yeah, that's right Norway! Thubbbpt!
Oh, is that the right answer? You were looking at me as though I was an idiot.
That's got nothing to do with the question.
She's a former psychiatric nurse, it's a professional appraisal!
The Big Brother Contestant said "Are you pushing it out, nigger?"
What does "Pushing it out" mean, Ian?
"Pushing it out"... is expressing enthusiasm... in dance form.
When the Revolution comes, I'm gonna tell them to leave you alone!

[questionable Party donation]
I've often wondered, I mean, so you're a wealthy philanthropist and you want to give your money away like a good public-spirited Christian? What gene is it that makes you want to give it to the Labour Party, why is that top of your list and not muscular dystrophy?
A good week for Body Language experts! Whose assessments miraculously reflected the political leanings of the papers they worked for...
There's a lot of discrimination against obese people in the NHS, I knew one Doctor who would write DTS in the notes, which means Danger to Shipping.

[establishment of NHS Foundation Trusts]
New Labour can't get out of the idea that everything has to make a profit, and if you say the State should fund it they say "Oh, that's a lot of outdated nonsense". It's like if you went round, threw a load of plates in the air and said "Gravity? That was 300 years ago!"

[SAT Tests]
All these kids were coming out of schools illiterate and innumerate so the Government said "We're going to introduce these tests to fix it" but then they realised no-one would pass them so it's all cancelled.
Yeah, but kids who are illiterate and innumerate, they don't count, do they?
[groans from the audience]
You'll be using it tomorrow!
The map on the back of the Euro coin features only the countries that are in the EU, and does not include Norway, giving Scandinavia an unsettling shape.
when the Yorkshire patients talk about their "privates" the Austrian Doctors think they mean their "Houses".

[Rupert the Bear gets a Blue Plaque]
Aren't those meant for real people?
Are you suggesting that Mr. Bear...?
Not for a moment!
I love Rupert the Bear stories, especially the one where Bill Badger was gassed.
What was the name of the man who ran the first Marathon?
Phidippides!
An actor's life for me!
I got no respect for the concept of Batman, based on my understanding of politics and that.
I'm sorry, what? What?

Batman is this high-powered millionaire, got all this technology, and he only use it on street-level crime. He don't focus on the Murdochs, Trump, Corporate, White-Collar crime, he only care about the purse-snatcher on the street! Batman is a Conservative's Wetdream. Fuck Batman!
[Silent]
And so the answer to your Odd One Out round...
Hold on! He's only just seen it.
What is the fastest growing language in the UK?
Emoji!
It is Emoji.
In which I happen to be fluent.
Oh! Laughing face laughing face crying face poo?

[clip of Baroness Thatcher saying she liked Rolf Harris's "Two little Boys" song]
"Did you think I'd leave you dying when there's room on my horse for two"? Maggie would've shot him right between the eyes!
Standard stuff or right-wing lunacy? What do YOU think, Nigel?
Even UKIP on a bad day can't compete with Mitt Romney!
Romney said "Tomorrow is the beginning of a brighter tomorrow..."
The Sun referred to the Cornish Liberation Army as the Oohh-Arrr A!
[pun on IRA]

[Undisclosed Offshore Holdings Scandal]
What was the Scandinavian Prime Minister's name?
Sven?
I get a German on the show and he uses a racial stereotype!

[Top Gear clip]
I think Jeremy's English is very good, considering.
This could be good news or it could be like the Pathway Project, where we were promised a new Spanking Hospital...
It's a kind of alternative therapy!
The author is not the first to suggest that Putin is
[whispers]
latently gay,
[back to normal]
there were a few recently deceased Psychologists, too...
Whenever Roger Beard puts on his Cucumber Suit, Roger Cucumber puts on his Beard suit.
I went to my optician and said I'd like something a Librarian would wear in a porn film, and he said he was sorry but he had no idea what I was talking about.
He probably hadn't been in many libraries.
He chose well.
Moving on, then.

[Muhammed Al Fayed's picture is in the odd one out round]
Now, I have to be careful what I say about him, because he pays my salary!

[Plebgate]
A police whistleblower has come forward to say that there was a plot to get Mitchell, and one of the officers had said "Right, we can stitch him up." I love the way he said it like something out of the Beano.
They're all whistleblowers, policemen. They all blow whistles!
Not anymore. You could have said that back when the show started!

[relentless and absurd grilling]
Can I just say that I am sorry for everything I've ever done ever?
This policeman stopped me on my bike, apparently it's a "lethal weapon".
Did you say "Do you know who I am?"
I've got no idea, myself.
Perhaps he could have told me...
I meant no plagiarisms.
I wouldn't accuse you of anything so calculated!
Nobody could plagiarise you, Boris! There is no-one like you, you are unique!
I said that, but a bit more fluent. You're whipping me up into a coma, Boris!
Did you study Philosophy, or did you just think you studied Philosophy?
How would I know?
My Wife wasn't a Miss World, but she was a Miss something...
A Mistake?
I quite liked Miss Bournemouth, but the tide's gone out...
Blank look again, Boris? "I must kill the Prime Minister..."
I could not fail to disagree with you less.
It's the phenomenonenon of the reversal of mores.
Do you want to see an American Politician with a funny nose?

[Diana Inquiry Result]
Commenting, the Head of the Metropolitan Police said "If we'd been in charge, she wouldn't have died." Unless of course, she'd tried to jump a ticket barrier at a London Underground Station!
The Tea Party, which is a sort of UKIP with guns...
Mitt Romney has come out strongly against Gay Marriage, because as a committed Mormon he believes that Marriage is a Sacrament between a man and no more than four women.
The thing about Academies is that they can't be run for profit, so they only attract people who want to raise standards. Or deny Evolution and introduce Sharia Law...
They say Gordon Brown is finished, but I say GORDON'S ALIVE!
Brian, you'd never guess you were an Actor!
I must confess I only got 9% on O-level Maths.
9%? That's an A-star now!
A whistling woman and a crowing hen...?
A whistling woman and a crowing hen may not look the same when the rain comes in. It's a weather thing. If a cow lies down it soon will snow, if a squirrel jumps, ho-di-ho.
I live by that proverb.
You poor devil.
It's confusing, but, you know...
They all end ho-di-ho, Medieval proverbs! Can you just repeat it one more time, Sir Trevor, for our amusement?
A whistling woman and a crowing hen...?
Change their name from Griselda to Ben?
Very good, but not the right answer. A whistling woman and a crowing hen are neither fit for God nor Men!
It really is a triumph of hope over experience...
Garlic deters MRSA? I think that's the first useful bit of information we've had on this show!
You bought one courgette?
I live alone!
Oooh! Buzz!
You've been on this kind of a high-end show before, haven't you?
One might ride a Quad Bike at Oxford, in the Quad!
By that logic, only bisexuals could ride bicycles.
It's like a trireme, Boris, you've heard of those?
Sara, you're a woman, have you got a mustard yellow coat?
I am a woman, yes I am! I don't really rock the mustard look, to be honest Michael, it's not me. It makes me look a bit like I've just done some crack, because it really washes me out.
Sara, you're a woman, have you got any Brogues?
I am a woman! I don't have any Brogues, no, they make me look like I've just done some crack.
The Curse of Tutankhamun states that anyone who gazes on the mummified face of the Pharaoh will meet a premature death. Here it is again.
Ben Jones and a team from Aberdeen University found that simply smiling and looking directly into the beholder's eye is enough to make one appear eight times more attractive.
Except in England, where it makes you "look like a nutter"
The Prince likes Pharrell, who is a hip-hop Master Mixer.
Your shoulders moved when you said Hip-hop!
They're supposed to, aren't they?
You know they only make you read this out so you look stupid, don't you, Boris?
Yes, it's a pact of steel...
The study found that women sway their hips less when they want to conceive. Sara, you're a woman and pregnant...?
Actually, I was born with a dislocated hip so I sort of wobble. I don't know about swaying, but look at me, it does the job.
I bet that Paul McCartney would like you.
We do know that the Beatles Greatest Hits were all written before we joined the EU.
Is that the definitive argument?
The definite argument is "Where's your coin, let's toss it!" That's what I shall be doing.
So you're saying it's a bunch of tossers?
I fear nobody knows which way it's going to go, nobody knows which way it should go, all we know is that it will mean THE END OF THE WORLD!
We're inviting Armageddon, then?

If we vote to Exit, apparently, everything, everything will collapse. Already Barbara Windsor on EastEnders has committed suicide in anticipation of Brexit. Our Houses will be worthless, there will be a Third World War, it's going to be appalling, so totally appalling. But of course, if we stay in, we are going to be overwhelmed by 200 million people coming here a week! Arriving on our shores. Mostly from Turkey but not delightful.
I'm amazed you're not the spokesman for both sides!
I feel in a way that I am! Because I know that they don't know, because I've been there before.
You've been a Tory MP, and you know that they know nothing?

Well I knew I had contempt for my constituents but I was amazed to find the feeling was mutual. I remember 20 years ago when we were voting to come out of the ERM, Exchange Rate Mechanism, we either all had to be in it or...
It's not The One Show Gyles, you can use big words!
I'm just trying to give some substance.
Don't interrupt Gyles during his one-man show!
The point is, at the beginning of the day we didn't know what was going to happen, while it was happening we didn't know what was happening, and when it had happened we didn't know what had happened.
Today was just a protest against the Conservative, the Conservative party, it was nothing to do with Vote Leave or the EU, it's against, it's against, uhm...
[trails off into silence]
He makes me look as if I know what I'm talking about!
His ambition got him as far as having an Egg with him. Maybe next year, who knows?
He's the kind of person who always has an Egg with him.
I heard there was someone who was going to throw an egg at me. There he is! There are hungry people in this country, young man, we need that egg!
Given we've known this vote was coming for a long time, you'd expect the sides to have their arguments in better form than they have done.
I don't feel like I've heard a coherent argument from either side. I'm confused!
You should be.
What should I do, Gyles?
Go back to Canada! Wait for us to join you because we will be escaping the hundreds of millions who will be coming here the moment the borders come down!

Please don't come to Canada, because with Trump we already have Americans threatening to come in. We've got to now build a wall, Americans are not as fit as Mexicans, it won't have to be a high wall...
Thousands of football fans are on the streets of Leicester today. Why is that, Ian?
They're very happy.
Why are they happy, Ian?
They've won.
What have they won, Ian?
They've won... the thing.
In Essex, a passenger takes the only course of action open to him after foolishly asking a taxi driver his opinion on Brexit.
[Clip of man jumping out of a car]
They've finally found the tomb of Tutankhamun but the bad news is he's dead.
I kind of struggle with History, really. I've got cavemen, Jesus, Henry VIII and then us. Anything in between...
That's basically it, anyway.
That's certainly the full school syllabus at the moment!
What did Howard Carter do when he first found the tomb?
Didn't he like wrench it open really roughly?
Didn't he die horribly, years later? The Curse of King Kong?
You've done the same History Course as Sara!
I come out of that fine American Education System...
Bring those men out here, we want to have sex with them!
Yes, this is another ruling about offensive language from those erratic dickwads at Ofcom.
Michael! Never thought I'd hear that!

Although the ruling concerned the word "Poof" the word that most concerned the Big Brother audience was the dreaded N-word... "Nightly". In spite of the ruling most people feel "Poof" is an unacceptable term for a Big Brother housemate, the correct term is "Retard".

Every year some dumb little white girl on Big Brother gets made the poster child for racism in this country. It's about context, they were friends, but Channel 4 didn't have no balls and caved to public pressure. If the white girl had been wearing a Police Officer's uniform...
Is this "Nigger" and "Poofter"?
No, they're "Michael" and "Reginald". Let's not get too informal!
It's context, Paul, we're friends!
In removing the mask Carter broke the body into 18 pieces.
Good God A'mighty!
According to the Mail, by the time Carter's team had finished King Tut had been decapitated, his torso cut in two, the arms and legs detached, and the pelvis separated from the trunk.
It's like he went to a Millwall football match!

This is Sir Ian Blair, who believes he should keep his job, despite the shooting of Jean Charles De Menezes, who has received a vote of no confidence from the London Assembly. What was his ballsy response?
If you've got the authority and confidence to sack me, do it, otherwise I'm going home.
He said it was just a one-off.

It wasn't for Menezes! Someone said in a bygone age Sir Blair would have been given a bottle of whiskey and a revolver and then would be escorted to his office to quietly do the honorable thing. Knowing him, he'd drink the whiskey and come out with the revolver!
Yes, there was no real reason to invent the Genetic Supermouse, the Scientists just wanted to see what happened if they did it. Any other pointless science research this week?
Someone's trained a Horse to say "How d'you do?" To confuse people walking through the countryside?
It's the dog washing machine!
What's going on here?
Is he riding a horse that's sunk under water? Unless it's snorkling. And saying "How d'you do..."
The Scientist said humans have the same gene manipulated in the mouse, but doing the experiment with humans would be wrong. Adding WHOO-HA-HA-HA!
Blow for lovers of lobster as scientists say they feel pain. Bloody scientists, next they'll be telling us foxes feel pain when you hit them with half a brick...
This is a report from the Drainage Research Group of the School of the Built Environment at Herriot-Watt University. Or, as it's more commonly known, Drgotsotbeahwu...

[Missing words round]
What can cause long stretches of disappointment and depression interspersed by moments of joy?
Is it "Being Alive"?
Aw! Ian!

[flu vaccine story]
It's all about killing the poor. The assertive middle-class people are always at the front of the queue.
Monkey Government!
What did Tony Blair keep quiet so people wouldn't think he was a nutter?
WMDs? Faith!
Yes, Tony Blair revealed he kept his Faith quiet and that God often spoke to him at difficult moments. To say "Don't drag me into it, you nutter!"
I just had a religious experience.

I saw Vera Lynne once and she said "I don't think anyone else could have a career like mine because Wars these days, they don't last long enough." I remember thinking it's not a complaint you hear often.
If we say it, it's a word!

[Missing words round]
David Suchet reveals that he used to hide what, playing Poirot?
Moustache!

Oh I know this one! He used to hide pennies up his arse and clench them between his buttocks, in order to get Poirot's mincing walk right! It was a trick he learned from Lawrence Olivier, who had more than pennies up his arse at one point!
Ha! Right down to the line, Godfrey?
Well, I know you're not going to ask me back...
Time now for the odd one out round. Ian and Ken, your four are, David Cameron, David Soul, Ken Livingstone and Randy Bumgardener.
Who's Randy Bumgardener?
I'm so glad I was here to hear you say that! David Soul wears his glasses like you Jerry!
Isn't that interesting? Because he played me in the Opera!
I've been played in...
Oh, you've been played!
Has Bumgardener, or whatever his name is...

What do you mean "Bumgardener, whatever his name is"? We know his name's Randy Bumgardener! There's no two ways about it! What was his parents thinking of? What was his mother thinking of? "Oh, your name's Bumgardener? I'm going to marry you!"
Nobody's done a play or Opera about Cameron so Bumgarden... I'm doing my best!
You're saying Cameron's the odd one out?
Very odd.
Randy Bumgardener...
This is your life!
You may not know this but he is the General Manager of Blairhouse, and that is the US President's Estate Guesthouse. Randy Bumgardner's father was called Delmar Bumgardener.
In an attempt to take the curse off Bumgardner!
And his mother was called Loretta Mincy. It's a good thing she didn't go double-barreled or she would have been a Mincy-Bumgardner!
They've tried to get young people involved by calling the Referendum "Votey McVoteface"?

The referendum, on the 23rd of June, that everybody's, like, really knowledgeable about! And they've left it up to us! I can't even work "Series Link". I'm worried that there's a lot of people like me who've been left with this decision to make, I mean, that's WHY we have government and that. My decision is who I want to make the decision for me.
Pot Black Snooker, The Biami Tribe, The Natural Environment Research Council's Polar Research Vessel, and the Fossilised Egg of an Elephant Bird.

Well we know about the Polar Vessel because people voted to call it "Boatey McBoatface" in an online poll or "Boring McBoring Face" but the Government decided that was wrong so they're going to call it "The Sir David Attenborough". But that, rather wonderfully, prompted a petition for Sir David Attenborough to change his name to "Sir David McDavidface".
This is about changing your name? It's not called "Pot Black" anymore?
Every colour is equal!
Is there a link to Sir David Attenborough?
It's because David Attenborough was the controller of BBC 2 back when Pot Black was commissioned in 1969. Because it was a program made for colour TV
Did he discover all these except for...
Boatey McBoatface!
Absolutely right. I thought it could have been a lot worse asking the British Public to decide on something. It could have been called "The Harold Shipman".
And now it's time for
[Jedi hand wave]
the pic-ture spin quiz.
And now it's time for
[Jedi hand wave]
the odd one out round.
And now it's time for
[Jedi hand wave]
the missing words round.
Samuel Pepys buried his cheese, and that's not a euphemism.
A new Superbreed of Sex-Mad, Sleepless Slugs has arrived from Spain.
Ah, an Alliterative Threat!
"I'm still using a P200, with a serial number B-80-108-17!" Gary, you're bonkers!
Punish one and warn a thousand.
This week we saw a sure sign the Referendum's on its way as Gordon Brown was brought out of retirement to dance on a ball like an old abused circus bear...

I think Cameron is saving the Queen's Death for when he needs a really big news story. I think one day he'll turn up for one of his weekly meetings with a big pillow in his briefcase. "Sorry, Ma'am, but ISIS has landed in Cornwall!"

This week Cameron and the Queen have been filmed making indiscreet comments about foreigners. This despite the fact we're always told the Royal Family are good for business and tourism. Perhaps if we had a country worth visiting we wouldn't have to parade around the product of centuries of incest in order to help sell fridge magnets.
This is the U-turn on dropping animal welfare codes on Chickens Farmed for Meat. Now, instead of looking forward to an agonising and brutal death, the chickens can look forward to a brutal death.
What could be more appropriate for David Attenborough than giving his name to a Polar Research Vessel as they both set out on a long, cold journey to a place of endless night?

[odd one out round]
Big slugs are coming to get us?
Is that what happens if you leave the EU?

Well I'm a Muslim and as a Muslim I speak for all the Muslims that's what we do, there are 1 billion Muslims, I've spoken to them, and they say that "Allahu Akbar" isn't just used for terrorism, but if you're going to do a drill in a shopping centre, it might come up. But hearing it in a shopping centre could just as well mean there's a great sale on at Next...

Someone wrote in to say "If you don't want to scare people you could do a drill with someone saying "I'm just going to blow myself up for a generic terrorist buzz"". Just what we need, postmodern terrorists!
I mean, no offense here, Frankie, but...
Is that the first time anyone's ever said "No offense" to Frankie Boyle?
None taken!

[Drunk Bishop of Southwark]
He walked into an arch and became what?
What?
An Archbishop!

[Ian has a sore throat]
This voice of yours, Ian, do you take requests?
I'll say anything.
Say "Have you ever been to Cairo, my dear boy?"
Have you ever been to Cairo, my dear boy?
Who brushes moths?
What do you mean "Who brushes moths?"
Well, I'm sure people do brush moths, but I defy you to prove it!
I AM A BRUSHMOTH-ER! I don't even know how to say it...
Horse used to make what?
Horseradish!
It's a good answer, but it's not right...
What found in Blackpool?
Black Water!
Black Water found in Black Pool! Well done...

[Police raid on Parliamentary Office]
It's a bit like school, isn't it? Well, it is, cos it's like someone's put a photo of someone's bum on the headmaster's desk, and they've said whose is this? And now we're trying to find out who put it there, everyone's saying "It wasn't me"...
Are bums like fingerprints, every one is different?
They discovered the bum print a long time before the fingerprint, the police are just too embarrassed to use it.
You need a big inkpad as well, to get on it.
Not every criminal is going to leave a bum print.
You've got to think ahead and put a photocopier in the corner of the room, as a temptation for them.
Those police always have warrants because those are fictional characters. Our police are less well-trained than our actors.

[as Bishop of Southwark]
You're my besht mate, you are!

[Trump]
This could be the next President.
I sense that's hard to get out?
I nearly said "And he'll meet with Prime Minister Johnson"
[goes crosseyed]
"to discuss being mad..."
Trump gave a Victory Speech, saying "We're going to win, and we're going to win bigly!"

[Tony Blair admits to wearing glasses]
It was Cherie's idea, actually, because she'd finally got tired of him squinting in bed.
Was he at the wrong end?
Who can say?
There are other reasons for squinting in bed, of course.
Such as?
Use your imagination, Angus! We'd send out a search party for it, but they'd never come back!
There's a lot of pain in this Country...
Do you have any idea how sinister that was?

You want to know where the illegal immigrants are? Well, I'll tell you, they're in the NHS! We've got this huge organisation, you can go unnoticed for years! As I was saying to Dr. Bin Laden the other day...
Most cows are called "Buttercup".
That must be very confusing for them!
What else has happened that has put a strain on relationships between the West and the Middle East?
Oh! This is the teddy bear.
The teddy bear, you're straight to it. Yes.
Yes, I don't know who Pudsey is, because the Children in Need bear is called "Pudsey", so I hope that's not...
That is a Deity! Actually, that is a deity of the Aturi pygmies who are sworn to kill everybody who works for the BBC.
So Pudsey may well be offending someone, but this...
Yes, it's the teacher, who, the bear was named "Mohamed after one of the kids in the class, and she's just been found guilty and 15 days in prison, then she'll be deported.
British Rail never made this fuss when that bloke named that bear Paddington
Yes, the mind boggles, never made a fuss then.
No.
Just stuck him by some suitcases and gave him a marmalade sandwich.
Well, you say that, but he'd been hanging round the station for ages with a label round his neck saying "Please introduce this bear to a life of Prostitution and Drug-addiction".
Unfortunately, he never bumped into you! So, you know. Do you think her mistake was allowing the pupils in the class to take a vote?
She didn't make any mistakes!
Yeah.
No.

She asked the children "What would you like to call the bear?", and they all said "Muhammed", and the boy said "Because my name's Muhammed."And she was surrounded by lunatics. Who then said "Death to the Primary School Teacher! Behead middle-aged women who'd like to do children a favour now!" And then taken to Court "This is a serious offence!", senior Muslim clerics in Sudan saying "Oh yes, this is on a par with Salman Rushdie!" "Oh yes, of course it is! Let's lash her!"
Senior Sudanese clerics were saying that this is part of a Western Plot against Islam, which is a rubbish plot.
To be fair, it has been uncovered in the early stages!
"We start with the bears, we move on to the giraffes, and from there Chaos, my friends!"
"The Animal Kingdom is ours!"
Anyway, they're moderate in the Sudan, at least she wasn't in Saudi!
In Saudi Arabia, they'd chop the bear's paw off! The stuffing comes out, and it's a nightmare.
Then it could be the mascot for the Saudi Children in Need Appeal!

British Teacher Gillian Gibbons was in Prison for 15 days after her class named a teddy bear Muhammed. Sudan's top clerics are demanding that the full force of the law be used over this stuffed bear incident. Of course, the diplomatic situation is at a delicate stage, so we have to be careful what we say about these vindictive, ranting nutters. One moderate Cleric suggested that the bear be renamed Winnie the Pooh, but when it emerged that Winnie the Pooh has a friend called Piglet, he was promptly stoned to death. Many people in Sudan are saying that the authorities over-reacted and the Sudanese Embassy in London called it "A storm in a teacup". WELL HOW DARE THEY INSULT THE VESSEL OF OUR NATIONAL BEVERAGE! MAY A THOUSAND SCONES RAIN DOWN ON THEIR HEADS!
